availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Hickman Walker (Crittenden County, Kentucky, circuit court clerk)

body.p: Crittenden County, Kentucky, merchant and circuit court clerk. Kentucky native. Married to Hortense Gregory on February 5, 1856, in Crittenden County. Farmer in Crittenden County in 1850. Merchant in Crittenden County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 1, p. 212A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 1, p. 503.

Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Crittenden County, KY, June 1863, p. 24 (Accessed via ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "James Hickman Walker (1827-1906)," Memorial #54394924, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/54394924 (accessed April 4, 2020).
